climbs.name: The Road Not Taken
climbs.fa: Scott Ayers, Charlie King, Avi Steinburg

content.description: Follow bolts up and over two overlaps to a bulge and a left facing corner. Head left and onto the awesome alligator skin plates where the route steepens. Lower (or rap) with a 70M rope! to the ground. Tie knots in the ends. It’s a long one.I’ve read that a 60M can be used, angling to rappeler’s right to a 4th class downclimb from the top of the boulders. I have not done this, and can not verify.
content.protection: 10 bolts and a light rack to 3”
content.location: The middle of the dome has a prominent wide crack. Lance Armstrong starts right of this up the slab.

climbs.name: Lance Armstrong Walked On The Moon

content.description: Start under a large boulder and follow the wide crack as it angles up and right. Go left at the overlap into the smaller left angling crack to the anchor shared with He’s Making It Up.
content.location: The wide crack at the left side of the dome.

content.description: The are 2 bolts near some seams. Climb here and then into a short section of crack. Move right onto the face and clip 2 more bolts. Follow chickenheads and easier climbing to the anchor. Rap or lower 100 feet to the ground.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a light rack to 3”
content.location: On the left side of the dome, look for the obvious wide crack. He’s Making It Up follows the ridge line left of the wide guy. Look for some thin seams and 2 bolts.

content.description: Follow the prow on the massive leaning block to the “A” shaped roof. Pull through the roof on jugs to the right and onward up to the anchor.Lower (or rap) with a 70M rope! to the ground. Tie knots in the ends. It’s a long one.I’ve read that a 60M can be used, angling to rappeler’s right to a 4th class downclimb from the top of the boulders. I have not done this, and can not verify.
content.location: In the middle of the dome, right of the wide crack. Start up the prow of the giant block leaning against the dome.

content.description: Chalkboard is the first dome that is reached from the Lost Canyon Trail. Mostly moderate climbing here.
